An agent sent 3981203534288847413456741832787090167795853189543950216202612678459211532666773067435427938289615471111191330821067055030642467213499483593060547017262817 using RSA, but accidentally leaked half of the private key bits. Recover the message exploiting this partial key exposure.

The flag format is flag{...}
n=4280797359385381190347187751354529493267107904277651654687428818849320655312057039347944425109445777219042725828450983362163961932551050060073519003082949, e=755019866758491668721067621716837430152894425257972508335794183243742467561502824649677627397598171388345231249676801666659178631090877354462592755927205, partial_p=9407486695677032644

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{4lkzjzm4}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3981203534288847413456741832787090167795853189543950216202612678459211532666773067435427938289615471111191330821067055030642467213499483593060547017262817
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
